document.heading: Small Purchase Authority Amendment Act of 1997

history.narrative: Law 12-50, the “Small Purchase Authority Amendment Act of 1997,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-231, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 1, 1997, and September 22, 1997, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 3, 1997, it was assigned Act No. 12-164 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-50 became effective on February 27, 1998.

The District of Columbia Procurement Practices Act of 1985, effective February 21, 1986 (D.C. Law 6-85; D.C. Code § 1-1181.1 et seq is amended as follows a) Section 320 is amended by adding a new subsection (j) that reads as follows j) Nothing in this act shall affect the District of Columbia Water and Sewer Authority’s powers to establish and operate its procurement system and to execute contracts pursuant to the Water and Sewer Authority Establishment and Department of Public Works Reorganization Act of 1996, effective April 18, 1996 (D.C. Law 11-111; D.C. Code § 43-1661 et seq b) A new section 321 is added to read as follows 321. Small purchase procurement Special small purchase procedures may be used by the Chief Procurement Officer or his or her designee, in accordance with regulations established pursuant to this act, for procurements not exceeding $25,000. Procurement requirements shall not be parceled, split, divided, or purchased over a period of time in order not to exceed the dollar limitation for use of these small purchase procedures. An employee who violates the provisions of this subsection shall be subject to suspension, dismissal, or other disciplinary action pursuant to District law Sec. 3. Fiscal impact statement.
